cyclone.name: CINDY
cyclone.current_location: about 360 miles SE of Galveston, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move northwest tonight, then north-northwest toward the upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coast, crossing the coast late Wednesday night and moving inland over southeast Texas Thursday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: upper Texas coast near the Texas-Louisiana border (east of Galveston)

weather_observation.warning_coast: San Luis Pass, TX eastward to the Mouth of the Pearl River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas coast (including Galveston Bay) through coastal southwest Louisiana and Mississippi
weather_observation.wind: Gusty tropical-storm-force winds (peak 40–50 mph) possible late Wednesday into Thursday with 34 % chance of sustained ≥34 kt.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft inundation possible along the immediate upper Texas coast and Galveston Bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with isolated totals to 6 inches could trigger flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain-bands Wednesday night and Thursday.
